xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: LDAP client signing requirements

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-SO-000400

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: Session security for NTLM SSP-based clients must be configured to require NTLMv2 session security and 128-bit encryption.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225056
RULE ID: SV-225056r991589

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Microsoft has implemented a variety of security support providers for use with Remote Procedure Call (RPC) sessions. All of the options must be enabled to ensure the maximum security level.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to "Require NTLMv2 session security" and "Require 128-bit encryption" (all options selected).

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-SO-000410

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: Session security for NTLM SSP-based servers must be configured to require NTLMv2 session security and 128-bit encryption.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225057
RULE ID: SV-225057r991589

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Microsoft has implemented a variety of security support providers for use with Remote Procedure Call (RPC) sessions. All of the options must be enabled to ensure the maximum security level.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers" ```o "Require NTLMv2 session security" and "Require 128-bit encryption" (all options selected).

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: Users must be required to enter a password to access private keys stored on the computer.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225058
RULE ID: SV-225058r958450

notes:notes.xhtml:p: For public key-based authentication, enforce authorized access to the corresponding private key.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: If the private key is discovered, an attacker can use the key to authenticate as an authorized user and gain access to the network infrastructure.
The cornerstone of the PKI is the private key used to encrypt or digitally sign information.

If the private key is stolen, this will lead to the compromise of the authentication and non-repudiation gained through PKI because the attacker can use the private key to digitally sign documents and pretend to be the authorized user.
Both the holders of a digital certificate and the issuing authority must protect the computers, storage devices, or whatever they use to keep the private keys.

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "System cryptography: Force strong key protection for user keys stored on the computer"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to "User must enter a password each time they use a key".

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: Windows Server 2016 must be configured to use FIPS-compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225059
RULE ID: SV-225059r958408

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of remote access sessions.
Implement organization-defined types of cryptography for each specified cryptography use.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: This setting ensures the system uses algorithms that are FIPS-compliant for encryption, hashing, and signing. FIPS-compliant algorithms meet specific standards established by the U.S. Government and must be the algorithms used for all OS encryption functions.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000033-GPOS-00014, SRG-OS-000478-GPOS-00223

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "System cryptography: Use FIPS compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing"

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-SO-000450

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The default permissions of global system objects must be strengthened.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225060
RULE ID: SV-225060r991589

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Windows systems maintain a global list of shared system resources such as DOS device names, mutexes, and semaphores. Each type of object is created with a default Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) that specifies who can access the objects with what permissions. When this policy is enabled, the default DACL is stronger, allowing non-administrative users to read shared objects but not to modify shared objects they did not create.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g., Symbolic Links)

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g., Symbolic Links)"

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-SO-000460

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: User Account Control approval mode for the built-in Administrator must be enabled.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225061
RULE ID: SV-225061r1050790

notes:notes.xhtml:p: The organization requires users to reauthenticate upon organization-defined circumstances or situations requiring reauthentication.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting configures the built-in Administrator account so that it runs in Admin Approval Mode.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account"

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: UIAccess applications must not be allowed to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225062
RULE ID: SV-225062r958518

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting prevents User Interface Accessibility programs from disabling the secure desktop for elevation prompts.

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Allow UIAccess applications to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop"

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-SO-000480

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: User Account Control must, at a minimum, prompt administrators for consent on the secure desktop.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225063
RULE ID: SV-225063r958518

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting configures the elevation requirements for logged-on administrators to complete a task that requires raised privileges.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to "Prompt for consent on the secure desktop".
The more secure option for this setting, "Prompt for credentials on the secure desktop", would also be acceptable.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-SO-000490

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: User Account Control must automatically deny standard user requests for elevation.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225064
RULE ID: SV-225064r1050790

notes:notes.xhtml:p: The organization requires users to reauthenticate upon organization-defined circumstances or situations requiring reauthentication.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting controls the behavior of elevation when requested by a standard user account.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users"

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-SO-000500

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: User Account Control must be configured to detect application installations and prompt for elevation.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225065
RULE ID: SV-225065r958518

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting requires Windows to respond to application installation requests by prompting for credentials.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation"

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-SO-000510

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: User Account Control must only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225066
RULE ID: SV-225066r958518

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting configures Windows to only allow applications installed in a secure location on the file system, such as the Program Files or the Windows\System32 folders, to run with elevated privileges.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations"

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-SO-000520

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: User Account Control must run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode, enabling UAC.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225067
RULE ID: SV-225067r1050790

notes:notes.xhtml:p: The organization requires users to reauthenticate upon organization-defined circumstances or situations requiring reauthentication.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting enables UAC.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode"

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-SO-000530

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: User Account Control must virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225068
RULE ID: SV-225068r958518

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Isolate security functions from nonsecurity functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting configures non-UAC-compliant applications to run in virtualized file and registry entries in per-user locations, allowing them to run.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: User Account Control: Virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations"

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UC-000030

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: Zone information must be preserved when saving attachments.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225069
RULE ID: SV-225069r991589

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Attachments from outside sources may contain malicious code. Preserving zone of origin (Internet, intranet, local, restricted) information on file attachments allows Windows to determine risk.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Do not preserve zone information in file attachments

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: The default behavior is for Windows to mark file attachments with their zone information.
If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for
xhtml:p.xhtml:code: User Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Attachment Manager >> "Do not preserve zone information in file attachments"

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000010

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225070
RULE ID: SV-225070r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller" user right may be able to retrieve the credentials of other accounts from Credential Manager.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000030

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Act as part of the operating system user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225071
RULE ID: SV-225071r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the "Act as part of the operating system" user right can assume the identity of any user and gain access to resources that the user is authorized to access. Any accounts with this right can take complete control of a system.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Act as part of the operating syste

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Act as part of the operating system"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000050

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Allow log on locally user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225072
RULE ID: SV-225072r958472

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Allow log on locally" user right can log on interactively to a system.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Allow log on locally

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Allow log on locally"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000070

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Back up files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225073
RULE ID: SV-225073r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Back up files and directories" user right can circumvent file and directory permissions and could allow access to sensitive data.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Back up files and directories

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Back up files and directories"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Create a pagefile user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225074
RULE ID: SV-225074r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Create a pagefile" user right can change the size of a pagefile, which could affect system performance.

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create a pagefile"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000090

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Create a token object user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225091
RULE ID: SV-225091r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Create a token object" user right allows a process to create an access token. This could be used to provide elevated rights and compromise a system.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Create a token object

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create a token object"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Create global objects user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225076
RULE ID: SV-225076r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Create global objects" user right can create objects that are available to all sessions, which could affect processes in other users' sessions.

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create global objects"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000110

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Create permanent shared objects user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225077
RULE ID: SV-225077r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Create permanent shared objects" user right could expose sensitive data by creating shared objects.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Create permanent shared objects

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create permanent shared objects"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Create symbolic links user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225078
RULE ID: SV-225078r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Create symbolic links" user right can create pointers to other objects, which could expose the system to attack.

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create symbolic links"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:
Systems that have the Hyper-V role will also have "Virtual Machines" given this user right. If this needs to be added manually, enter it as "NT Virtual Machine\Virtual Machines".

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Debug programs user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225079
RULE ID: SV-225079r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the "Debug programs" user right can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel, providing complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components. This right is given to Administrators in the default configuration.

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Debug programs"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000200

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Force shutdown from a remote system user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225080
RULE ID: SV-225080r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Force shutdown from a remote system" user right can remotely shut down a system, which could result in a denial of service.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Force shutdown from a remote system

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Force shutdown from a remote system" to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Generate security audits user right must only be assigned to Local Service and Network Service.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225081
RULE ID: SV-225081r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Generate security audits" user right specifies users and processes that can generate Security Log audit records, which must only be the system service accounts defined.

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Generate security audits" to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000220

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Impersonate a client after authentication user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225082
RULE ID: SV-225082r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Impersonate a client after authentication" user right allows a program to impersonate another user or account to run on their behalf. An attacker could use this to elevate privileges.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Impersonate a client after authentication

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Impersonate a client after authentication"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Increase scheduling priority user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225083
RULE ID: SV-225083r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Increase scheduling priority" user right can change a scheduling priority, causing performance issues or a denial of service.

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Increase scheduling priority"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000240

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Load and unload device drivers user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225084
RULE ID: SV-225084r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Load and unload device drivers" user right allows a user to load device drivers dynamically on a system. This could be used by an attacker to install malicious code.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Load and unload device drivers

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Load and unload device drivers"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000250

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Lock pages in memory user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225085
RULE ID: SV-225085r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
The "Lock pages in memory" user right allows physical memory to be assigned to processes, which could cause performance issues or a denial of service.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Lock pages in memory

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Lock pages in memory"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000260

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Manage auditing and security log user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225086
RULE ID: SV-225086r958434

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Protect audit information from unauthorized access.
Protect audit information from unauthorized modification.
Protect audit information from unauthorized deletion.
Allow organization-defined personnel or roles to select the event types that are to be logged by specific components of the system.

Provide the capability for organization-defined individuals or roles to change the logging to be performed on organization-defined system components based on organization-defined selectable event criteria within organization-defined time thresholds.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Manage auditing and security log" user right can manage the security log and change auditing configurations. This could be used to clear evidence of tampering.
Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029, SRG-OS-000063-GPOS-00032, SRG-OS-000337-GPOS-00129

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Manage auditing and security log

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Manage auditing and security log" to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000270

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Modify firmware environment values user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225087
RULE ID: SV-225087r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Modify firmware environment values" user right can change hardware configuration environment variables. This could result in hardware failures or a denial of service.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Modify firmware environment values

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Modify firmware environment values"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000280

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Perform volume maintenance tasks user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225088
RULE ID: SV-225088r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Perform volume maintenance tasks" user right can manage volume and disk configurations. This could be used to delete volumes, resulting in data loss or a denial of service.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Perform volume maintenance tasks

xhtml:p.xhtml:p: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> Perform volume maintenance tasks to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Profile single process user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225089
RULE ID: SV-225089r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Profile single process" user right can monitor non-system processes performance. An attacker could use this to identify processes to attack.

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Profile single process"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000300

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Restore files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225092
RULE ID: SV-225092r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the "Restore files and directories" user right can circumvent file and directory permissions and could allow access to sensitive data. It could also be used to overwrite more current data.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Restore files and directories

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Restore files and directories"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: WN16-UR-000310

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: The Take ownership of files or other objects user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
cdf12:description.xhtml:code:
GROUP ID: V-225093
RULE ID: SV-225093r958726

notes:notes.xhtml:p: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

cdf12:rationale.xhtml:p: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.
Accounts with the "Take ownership of files or other objects" user right can take ownership of objects and make changes.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:ident: CIS Recommendation: Take ownership of files or other objects

xhtml:p.xhtml:code: Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Take ownership of files or other objects"
xhtml:p.xhtml:p: to include only the following accounts or groups:

Ensure 'Threshold' is 'Less Than Or Equal' to '3'
Ensure 'Observation Window' is 'Greater Than Or Equal' to '900'

Ensure 'Max Passwd Age' is 'Less Than Or Equal' to '5184000'
Ensure 'Max Passwd Age' is 'Not Equal' to '0'

Ensure 'Min Passwd Len' is 'Greater Than Or Equal' to ''

Ensure 'SaveZoneInformation' is 'Windows: User Registry Value' to ''

oval-sc:object.comment: This is the default family object. Only one family object should exist.
This registry key identifies the Windows ProductName
Ensure 'Duration' is 'Greater Than Or Equal' to '900'
Ensure 'secreateglobalprivilege' is set to 'Administrators, LOCAL SERVICE, NETWORK SERVICE, SERVICE'
Ensure 'Threshold' is 'Less Than Or Equal' to '3'
Ensure 'Observation Window' is 'Greater Than Or Equal' to '900'
Ensure 'senetworklogonright' is set to 'Administrators, Authenticated Users, ENTERPRISE DOMAIN CONTROLLERS' - DC
Ensure 'seimpersonateprivilege' is set to 'Administrators, LOCAL SERVICE, NETWORK SERVICE, SERVICE'
Ensure 'seauditprivilege' is set to 'LOCAL SERVICE, NETWORK SERVICE'
Ensure 'Password Hist Len' is 'Greater Than Or Equal' to '24'
Ensure 'SaveZoneInformation' is 'Windows: User Registry Value' to ''
Ensure 'Max Passwd Age' is 'Less Than Or Equal' to '5184000'
Ensure 'Min Passwd Len' is 'Greater Than Or Equal' to ''
Ensure 'Min Passwd Age' is 'Greater Than Or Equal' to '86400'
Ensure 'Max Passwd Age' is 'Not Equal' to '0'
Ensure 'NoPreviewPane' is 'Windows: User Registry Value' to ''

win-sc:wmi57_item.win-sc:wql: SELECT Setting FROM RSOP_SecuritySettingBoolean WHERE KeyName='LSAAnonymousNameLookup' AND Precedence=1
